## Initial Candidates

Stage 1 identified the following candidates based on round white ball-shaped mushroom on grassland with no visible stem:

- **Giant Puffball (Calvatia gigantea)** — high confidence — round, white, grassland
- **Common Puffball (Lycoperdon perlatum)** — medium confidence — round, white
- **Young Amanita (button stage)** — low confidence — safety inclusion, egg-like appearance

## Verification

### Giant Puffball (Calvatia gigantea)
| Feature | You described | Dataset says | Verdict |
|---------|--------------|-------------|--------|
| Shape | round ball-shaped | round to oval, sometimes irregular | MATCH |
| Colour | white | white when young, yellowing with age | MATCH |
| Habitat | grassland | meadows, grassland, gardens | MATCH |
| Stem | no stem visible | stemless or very short base | MATCH |
| Size | not described | 10-50cm across | MISSING |

**Overall**: Strong match for a puffball, but CRITICAL SAFETY CHECK required
**Edibility**: Edible when young and interior is pure white

### Young Amanita (button stage)
| Feature | You described | Dataset says | Verdict |
|---------|--------------|-------------|--------|
| Shape | round ball-shaped | egg-like or button shape when young | PARTIAL MATCH |
| Colour | white | white (Destroying Angel) or pale (Death Cap) | MATCH |
| Habitat | grassland | woodlands but can appear near trees in grassland | PARTIAL MATCH |

**Overall**: Cannot eliminate without cross-section check — young Amanita buttons resemble small puffballs
**Edibility**: DEADLY if a young Death Cap or Destroying Angel

## Assessment

This is most likely a puffball species, but a critical safety check must be performed before eating.

## What Would Help

You MUST slice this mushroom in half from top to bottom and examine the cross-section:
- **Pure white, uniform, marshmallow-like interior** = puffball (edible)
- **Any internal structure visible — forming cap, gills, or stem outline** = this is a young Amanita button stage and potentially DEADLY

Also: how large is it? Giant Puffballs can be 20-50cm across, which rules out Amanita confusion.

## Safety Notes

⚠️ **MANDATORY CHECK**: Always slice any puffball-like mushroom in half before eating. Young Amanita (including the deadly Death Cap) can resemble puffballs in their button/egg stage. If you see any internal structure when sliced, it is NOT a puffball — discard it.
